      Thanks Rainsberger

 

      Actually the engine will a supply chain model and come up with an
optimized outputs. Being an enterprise application

      We do have large number of models and test cases to do that. each
and every supply chain model the outputs will be different. Ofcourse we
do have a defined testing team to test vivid usecases, models etc.. in a
different aspects. But for a developer in the engine side I would like
to execute a basic minimal set of unit test case and verify the same in
the JUnit way. So that I an automate the things for the future release.

      If I wanted to get baseline data .. then I will end up in doing
the DAOs for all the tables and do the comparision right.. 

 

      -S

      

 

-----Original Message-----
From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...] 
Sent: Tuesday, June 15, 2004 11:24 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Junit Test Cases for Database records

 

Sadhasivam Jayabalaganesan wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> We have a requirement to clone certain set of database table records
and
> move to mirror tables in other schema. This is a legacy application
and
> was done in Oracle PL/SQL. How do I write unit test cases to make sure
> the selected records are moved correctly?

If the goal is to mirror tables, does PL/SQL provide support for asking 
whether tables have identical data?

> Further we have another requirement. we have a modeling engine related
> to supply-chain. The engine captures the model and validate it and
write
> its metric data to some standard tables..( only output to the table).
> 
> So how do I write JUNIT test cases to validate the engine process ?

Put in some test data and check the result that the engine intends to 
write to the database. Is there anything that prevents you from doing
that?
--
